jBHu788a6BN3qdisZLAvNg.text: The food is great, there has never been a problem with the food. However, after being told that I need to pay an additional $5.00 delivery charge because Vinny and his drivers don't want to wait the 1-2 minutes for Security at the front gate of my community to call me to let them in, that turned me off. I used to order from them constantly and when I tried to compromise with them by saying that I would tell Security to let them in once they gave my name and address and would no longer need to wait to call, it was still not good enough. Vinny insisted that I somehow convince Security to let him in when he says he is the Payless Pizza guy without giving a name, address or location inside the community he is going.  Essentially, Vinny expects them to just let him in without them knowing where he is going. What's the point of having Security if they are just letting everyone in, it's the entire principal of their profession.  Like I said, food is great. Trying to hustle me for 5 bucks, I will find somewhere else that has good food at this point.

NpdEbPg71lAkRmlCNKpDgg.text: I found Payless on delivery.com where it had 4 stars.Then I came to Yelp to check out more reviews. A few in, I was sold and made my order. I'm from New Jersey and take my pizza seriously. I've spent 16 years in Los Angeles and what they call pizza is a sacrilege. I went to pick up my order and found myself transported back to my childhood in Jersey where once a week we'd pick up our pepperoni pizza at our local pizza place. I was greeted like I was an old friend even though it was my first time there. There was even a guy from Jersey sitting down eating pizza when I arrived. I was shown the pizza and I KNEW I was in the right place. I actually had to put it in the trunk to keep from grabbing a slice to eat on the way home. The scent still drove me nuts, though. lol If you're from NJ/NY and miss the pizza you know and love, come here. You don't have to tell them anything; they know what to do. I will be a weekly customer.

wSdlv4ABfKlq7ofNlBmUQQ.text: I'm From Hawaii, been looking at Payless Pizza #2 and Ribs for a few months prior to my trip, my expectations were so so - but they had a few menu items that caught my eye, decided to check out this place, its really small 2 tables a 4 seater and 2 seater. cVsyV8FrqiAC5kzKGmaY5g.text: First I would like to say Vinny (the owner) is genuinely a nice person and you can clearly see he takes great pride in all the food he makes. We were greeted so very nicely by Vinny and his staff. We ordered food to go but while waiting we had a couple of slices and garlic knots. The pizza is very good and is a True New York style pizza. The garlic knots were very good too, I especially loved the sauce that came with them.  To go we ordered chicken parm sub, spaghetti and meatballs, house salad with ranch dressing and two cannolis.   My salad was fresh, crisp and delicious. I was told the ranch dressing is homemade and it was excellent! The spaghetti and meatballs was very good and a very good sized portion. The meatballs were tender and flavorful. My husband said his chicken parm sub was "excellent" and this is a very rare response from him! The cannolis were fresh and delicious Yum! I must mention the to go packaging was done right. Everything was secure and properly packaged (so important!).  it was well over 40 minutes by the time we got our food home but the food stayed piping hot! The bread from the hot sub did not turn soggy and was still fresh and held up nicely thanks to the packaging, quite impressive! The menu is very appealing and extensive and there is something for everyone; pizza, pasta dinners, hot and cold subs, fried chicken, chicken wings, ribs, burgers, salads, desserts and so much more. I look forward to returning to try more items from the menu and thanks Vinny for great conversation and great food!

J58mNRZVEHT71VVuUgCycg.text: Met some friends there yesterday for late lunch.  I am from Chicago which has the best pizza on earth.  I don't like thick crust because it fills me too fast so was surprised that the crust is perfect.  Get a cup of sauce to dunk crust.  I got a veggie pizza with sausage.  All the veggies tasted fresh and flavorful. The sausage did not have the Chicago flavor but was very good. The entire staff is very friendly and made us feel comfortable immediately.  There is limited seating inside and outside.  I plan to go back to get their 4X prize winning ribs then I have to try their pasta.  The prices are reasonable especially because of the great quality and large portions they serve.  Highly recommend trying this pizza joint!

mSg2axX5O37mf9yIvLqvUw.text: We were looking for some pizza close to our hotel. This place came up and we tried it. It's a little shop with two tables, but they know how to cook True New York style pizza.  Way inexpensive and awesome taste.

aTD4wL7sotyGC6NqhFKsRA.text: We stopped by yesterday for lunch. We were just looking for a quick bite before heading to a local event. Wow. What a pleasant surprise. We looked at the reviews and were hopeful, but as an ex New Yorker I will say THIS is the real deal!! Not just the food... which ROCKS!! But Vinnie just made the experience for us. We had the pizza and philly steaks. Both were awesome. And the fries... extra crispy (just how we like them) with a great house seasoning!! I really don't think you could go wrong with anything on this menu. It's clear there is love in all the dishes here. As a former New Yorker, and chef in New York, this place has my stamp of approval!!

XEFUJphSxX6BpaffChgCXw.text: I would've liked to have been able to review Payless Pizza...But I never got the chance to try them.   About 90 minutes ago, I went on GrubHub, saw that Payless was very close by, and they offered delivery. I'm new in town, don't have a car yet, and I'm staying with a friend who lives literally across the street from this place. So when I ordered a 16" Meat Lover's pie for delivery at 8pm, I figured it'd be quick.   I was a little disappointed when GrubHub said the order would show up no later than an hour and 10 minutes from then, but oh, well. I kept my phone right next to me with the ringer up on case there were any problems.   Then, I waited.   Imagine my surprise when at exactly nine-oh-nine...with ONE MINUTE to spare - I got an email saying that my order had been cancelled, and my money refunded. Why? Because Payless had evidently had "a question," and they "couldn't reach me to ask it." Now, remember, the driveway to their parking lot is exactly across the street from the complex where I'm staying. The pizza in question is right there on the menu, and I ordered it as-is...no special requests or substitutions. I had my phone on an end table next to me listening for a ring in case of problems. And I got the message with only A MINUTE TO SPARE that my nearly $25.00 order (including pre-paid 20% tip!) was not going to be coming after all.   So, I borrowed my roommate's car, and now I'm angrily eating Chinese food at a place up the road. All because the staff at Payless are apparently too incompetent to deliver what would have been a $25.00 order ACROSS THE STREET...But also so lax on customer service that they waited until LITERALLY THE LAST MINUTE to tell me as much!  To be honest, I'm actually kind of impressed. That's a SPECIAL level of incompetence. So, bravo, Payless Pizza. You've shown me a new low in ball-dropping.  EDIT: Just double-checked the phone number and address I gave GrubHub (since "Vin" seems keen to point fingers and pin his failure on others rather than own up and apologize), and both are correct.   In a world of GPS and Google Maps, the fact remains that Payless would rather blame anyone else but themselves (and try to get you to believe that I don't even know EITHER my own address OR phone number) rather than acknowledge their apparent inability to deliver a pizza to an address less than a quarter of a mile away.   Go ahead, Payless. Blame the customer. See how that works out for you.

fIqNW7Swa_Y8ekUtexm3SQ.text: We LOVE this place.....and order from them often.....their menu has such a huge variety of food that it pleases everyone's different cravings all at once....  i usually only order from them through eat24....so ive never dealt with their customer service over the phone but our delivery guy is awesome and is usually him every time4....hes super sweet....  the food is always fresh and delivered on time....we will for sure eat here alot in the future

ZoTbIhH9YDsH1adDkHfhdw.text: Been coming here for about a year. And the quality of food is amazing..Pizza is great, but if your looking to try something from an Italian guy try his ribs..OMG LOVE IT!!

VXrCRvgaVG4nV-X_Ac4FYA.text: When these guys promise you a great New York slice, they're not yanking your chain.  The wife and I are a couple of lifetime NYers, visiting Vegas for our first time.  We found Vinny's on sheer luck and his pizza is absolutely incredible.  We ordered the White Spinach Pizza.  It came out hot and fast.  And Vinny's crust defies logic.  It's the perfect thickness.  It's soft, yet very crispy.  It holds up to the toppings like a heavyweight champ in the 12th round.  The ricotta cheese was also A+ stuff.  To the point that I'm planning on finding time on our trip to order one of his Calzones.  Trust me when I say that this pizza is top of the mark anywhere in New York.  If we end up moving out here, I'll be calling in orders or driving in at least once a week,.  As for the people, the boss is a transplanted New Yorker, a retired fireman,  who's warm, witty, welcoming and shared some of his experiences about what to expect if we decided to move to the Vegas-area (we mentioned that we've been considering it,)  The general consensus is that what makes NY Pizza great is in our water.  Vinny's proves them all wrong.  He's got the magic.

NMibi7Oy75Gpw2n22N949Q.text: Whenever I come I always get the best service!!!! I'm so indecisive and the owner really takes his time to help me decide what to get. Everything I've tried has been amazing. They're open 24 hours too!

7Y2uaET57xURHo90tZAWCg.text: Don't let the small size of this place fool you. This is hands down the best NY style pizza I've found outside of NYC!   While I was waiting for my order, the owner Vinny came over and introduced himself, being that he noticed that I was a new face (that's a great sign- means there are a lot of regulars). He is a really nice guy and gave me a brief history of how this restaurant came to be. He's retired FDNY and comes from a large Italian family who had a pizza place in Brooklyn.   That's when I got really excited. Because I was pretty sure this pizza was going to be great. I had ordered an 18" pepperoni and bacon pizza.  I ran home and opened up the box. HUGE slices, and definitely authentic New York Style. I took one bite and was in love.  I also got the combo appetizer and a small salad, and that was delicious too.   Of course there was no way I was going to finish the pizza and appetizer in one sitting. So I'll be having leftovers for the next few days. Fine by me!  Thanks Vinny! You have one more regular now :)

cYdpXo5MsHw9Un8eVYxhZA.text: I work nearby and was sick of eating Carl's Jr all the time for lunch, so I found this place through eat24. I've eaten here twice this week, and am about to place another order! The prices are very reasonable and the owner is super nice. Most importantly, the food is great! I've only eaten the Philly cheese steak so far. Vinny recommended that I try his pizza, but I'm so addicted to his cheese steak, I don't know if I'll ever order anything else! I really like the French fries too. I usually overload mine with salt, but these fries don't really need it. I'm very satisfied with my food and service experiences here.

RqhgW2sTODTG-fiFFcjsFw.text: This is Ny pizza to the west coast. Amazing !!! The owner vinny is one of a kind. I highly recommend Payless pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Payless Pizza - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nrefa5TVjogujPpKGUod9Q.text: 3rd time ordering from here...3rd time was the charm! The first delivery took over an hour and by the time we got the food, pizza was cold,burgers were ok but the fries were soggy! I didnt review at that time because the driver, an older nice man, called saying he was running late and he apologized again when delivering food...2nd time the fingers were so small & not very good & the pizza was just soaking in so much grease...but we enjoyed their burgers and kids still ate the pizza after I wiped off the grease w/paper towels! Now tonight...delivery was on time, pizza was hot, & the burgers were amazing! You might think its weird since its a pizza place but you must order their burgers! We will be ordering again & hopefully we get the same results as tonight! I think the owner read some of the old reviews & made the right changes, I might even take a chance & give the chicken fingers another try next time!

V9ZOMqbeS-jQxvIAL2107g.text: If you go for just pizza or ribs they are great. I ordered some wings though and i can say honestly they were the smallest wings i have ever seen. The wing sauce was not the best either. I thought i was getting a good deal at 12 wings for the same price as others charge for 10 but after eating all 12 i was still left wanting. I have also found their side dishes with dinner are old tasting. Say no to cole slaw, potato salad, macaroni. Fries are ok though.

GUx4tite8mr6ACWQQhNyAw.text: Ordered our two favorite items, from which we tend to judge in general the establishment as a whole: cheese steak with everything and 1/2 bucket of hot wings.  Both were excellent! Hot wings on the smaller more natural sized side, crispy edges, good heat, and well sauced without being wet and dripping. Cheesesteak with everything means cheese, peppers, onions, and mushrooms. I prefer mine with a drizzle of ranch sauce, but even without it the sandwich was juicy, flavorful, the bread held up well but was soft, came with seasoned fries...perfect! We indulged with tiramisu - thankfully had the forethought to get two - perfectly balanced, good coffee flavor, creamy, rich but not too sweet. Was ready on time, had carry out service (wow!), and the aroma in the car had my mouth watering. Will definitely order again!!

Yykqj9M0BZjIBGH0SCjlVQ.text: Such great tasting pizza and chk parm!! Came across this spot and could not have been more pleased.  Vinny you the man

wEuEY55DGcP1peZYW_Jx1A.text: Came in for the check-in offer. (free personal cheese pizza 7$ value) it was very good. Highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area. Friendly staff. Inside is a little small, so if you have more than 4 people in your party I'd recommend taking it to go or having it delivered.

uV9ALthTIipvTj1Cms-Cmw.text: Great pizza, amazing garlic knots, really good prices.

JAgpKZfPdZCqNYmw3ku5ZQ.text: First I must say Vinny is the bomb.com from one New Yorker to another.. I feel so bad taking so long to write this review.. I came here with my pain in the butt who claimed this was the place to go for my beloved NY style pizza.. I immediately thought umm what do you know about NYC pizza you are from North Carolina, but I went anyway. I am a tough critic when it comes to my Pizza, Chinese, Gyros, Sandwiches... yes sandwiches, or Italian food.. I was born and raised in Brooklyn NYC so we are naturally tough critics from birth. Well let me start off by saying the prices remind me of my beloved NYC neighborhood pizzerias. The ingredients are fresh and the pizza can be folded! Yes this passes the fold test.. The wings were really good also and they have blue cheese.. major plus... Anyone from NY the city or upstate knows wings should only be served with blue cheese and please do not dip your pizza in ranch. All I can say is from the decor to the small dining room I felt like I was back in Brooklyn for the hour we were there.. Keep in mind the food didn't take that long but my pain in the butt likes to talk and in his mind him and Vinny go way back... All and all great job Vinny for bringing a taste of NYC to Vegas.

E_1B1wZBTnAP-uY6Ex_Xng.text: Best pizza in Las Vegas!! The closest you'll get to New York pizza on the West Coast! I came across this pizzeria by driving by and decided to stop in! They have a great deal on 2 slices and a drink for only $4.50!! Pizza is always fresh and you can never go wrong with the ribs!!

7wpVkYd3AGmtSrhp82Eu9w.text: Excellent pizza, cheese is great flavor.  Burgers and fries really good.  Store is very clean and organized.

0ip09y5FIyHuYxn_GkKKBA.text: Took a chance on this small pizza place based on the ratings on Yelp. Me and my friends wanted some yummy food that was budget friendly. So glad we did. Payless Pizza is a small pizza joint that is big on taste and easy on your pocket. Vinny the owner gave us great service. We got a large pizza, a few sides of meatballs and a large antipasto salad. The portions were good size. The meatballs and pizza were the best I have since visiting the east coast. As a Californian ranch dressing lover I also enjoyed their homemade ranch. Vinny didn't like that I put ranch on the meatballs (because like any True Italian they dont get the non-Italain obsession with ranch). Even with our difference of opinion of the ranch and its use, Vinny still gave me and my friends service with a smile. We have found our new favorite place to get delicious Italian food a short journey from the strip. Thanks again Vinny for the great food, service and being a former NYC firefighter. We will definitely be stopping in anytime we are in Vegas.

oeqfa0TXhvV4K5TrDw4Z8A.text: I am from Santa Rosa, CA and was looking for a salt free meal. I discovered Payless Pizza off of Tropicana Dr while driving around LV. I told Vincent (owner) my story, and he immediately went into action. Just like a typical New Yorker as they do. He allowed me to use his personal Wi-Fi which is very uncommon in these turbulent days. The current time is about 5:30 Saturday and his table sit-down are entirely full with some people waiting in there cars for their Pizza. It's not important what they say, it's all about what they do. Vincent "Walks the Talk" for sure.

EnvAUDg8T_Rh_iaBRu437Q.text: We are truly blessed to have found this wonderful place. The food is not only phenomenonal but AUTHENTIC and the owner Vinny is so friendly everyone feels like family. I can truly say not one person who walks thru his door will leave feeling disappointed or hungry.

nirOBCjX2XnEXmXYQOCN0g.text: Great food, great service, affordable! If you think you have found the best pizza or Italian in Vegas you haven't been to this place!

d_E0e3YSq4zFpDxxQ8IxLA.text: This is by far the best food I've had since leaving by 18 years ago. I have had it delivered three times and each time all was delicious. The soups are my favorite , minestrone and pasta fagoli. The garlic knots smelled delicious from the moment they came into the house and were delicious! Had the eggplant/ricotta pizza. And ham calzone both out of this world good. I don't know how I found this place but what a great find. Vinny,  the owner is a very nice guy who happens to come from next town over on Long Island . He even delivered my last order! Food is fresh which I have to have , hate when restaurants want to pass off food they should throw away. Defiantly order from here. Real Italian food ! Like what my mother would make

E3smPYUdm6PelDyxcI507g.text: I was getting my brand new Ferrari washed and was walking around looking for a place to eat. I've always had great experiences walking into small hole in the wall places that I would normally never drive by, so when I came across Vinnys Payless pizza, I had to see what it was all about...When I met Vinny ,the owner, I had no idea what to get. And instead of telling me how incredible the food was like most restaurant owners, he gave me a free pepperoni slice and told me I will be ADDICTED. And boy was he right !!!! Even though I wanted to buy a whole pizza to myself after tasting the best pizza of my life, I had to hold myself back because of my low carb diet. So Vinny went out of his way again and prepared the most incredible Gyro salad that I ever had which was not even on the menu !! What makes this place so different and special besides the fact that the food is so incredibly good, fresh, and ADDICTING, is the generosity, service, and passion that Vinny displays with every person that walks into his place, even though they are complete strangers. I just met this guy and already I feel like I am a part of the family. That's how comfortable this guy makes you feel !!!! Thanks for everything Vinny !! You got another customer for life !!!!!!
